channel.title: NYT > Business > Economy
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 The New York Times Company

item.title: Job Gains Disguise Weakness Beyond Service Industries
item.description: The unemployment rate rose in September as more people looked for jobs, according to data delayed by the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: September Jobs Report Injects More Uncertainty Into Fed’s December Decision
item.description: Policymakers at the central bank are at odds over the need to cut interest rates for a third straight meeting, as inflation picks up again and the labor market slows down.
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith

item.title: Delayed Jobs Data to Give Snapshot of a Labor Market Under Stress
item.description: Economists expect that employment growth was anemic in September, before the government shutdown delayed data collection.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: This report will be the last one until mid-December.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis and Colby Smith

item.title: California Has a Legal Clause for Housing That Could Put NIMBYs in a Corner
item.description: For years, the state has been nudging its cities to build housing to address a severe shortage. Maybe what they needed was a shove.
item.dc:creator: Conor Dougherty and Gabriela Bhaskar

item.title: After Shutdown, Labor Department Says Some Data is Gone for Good
item.description: Surveys were delayed and some cannot be collected at all, officials said, further complicating the Federal Reserve’s decision on interest rates next month.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis and Colby Smith

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Sent Trade Plummeting in August
item.description: The steep tariffs President Trump issued in August led to a contraction in imports and the trade deficit, newly released data shows.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: A City Is Broke. Can Billionaires’ Urbanist Dream Offer It a Last Chance?
item.description: Suisun City has tried to revive its fortunes for years. The latest idea: Annex land owned by California Forever, a tech-billionaire-funded plan for a new city north of San Francisco.
item.dc:creator: Conor Dougherty

item.title: Trump Says America Is in ‘Golden Age,’ Straining to Address Affordability
item.description: Speaking at a gathering of McDonald’s franchise owners and operators, the president boasted that he had “normalized” inflation.
item.dc:creator: Erica L. Green

item.title: High Beef Prices? Trump Official Blames Biden and Migrants.
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said migrants were bringing sick cows across the border, snarling beef supply chains.
item.dc:creator: Alan Rappeport

item.title: Former Fed Official Violated Trading Rules, Disclosures Show
item.description: Adriana D. Kugler, who stepped down as a governor in August, reported trades in stocks, including Apple and Southwest Airlines, in 2024.
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith

item.title: Trump Administration Lifts Some Food Tariffs in Effort to Ease Prices
item.description: It is walking back levies on imports including beef and coffee in what critics say is an admission that tariffs raised prices in the first place.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: Trump Turns to Affordability Message Amid Economic Frustration
item.description: The Trump administration is facing backlash from American consumers as higher costs from tariffs blunt wage gains.
item.dc:creator: Alan Rappeport

item.title: Trump Officials Prepare Tariff Exemptions, Seeking to Lower Food Prices
item.description: If the proposal goes into effect, it would be the latest rollback of one of President Trump’s key economic policies over concerns about affordability.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson, Maggie Haberman and Tyler Pager

item.title: Canada-U.S. Travel Drops for 10th Month Amid Trump Tariff Tensions
item.description: The drop has been reflected in air and car travel, according to Canadian statistics. Tensions over tariffs placed by the Trump administration spurred calls for Canadians to spend their money at home.
item.dc:creator: Livia Albeck-Ripka

item.title: A BlackRock-Backed Roofing Conglomerate Goes Bust
item.description: Investment firms are buying and bundling contractors, leaving some workers and customers worse off.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: Trump Tries to Seize ‘Affordability’ as Americans’ Economic Worries Grow
item.description: The issue has buoyed Democrats and is resonating with an American electorate that is souring on the president’s economic agenda.
item.dc:creator: Erica L. Green

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Hit Specialty Grocery Stores for Some Immigrant Communities Especially Hard
item.description: For immigrant communities from countries with especially high duties, food costs have risen sharply courtesy of President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: A MAGA Senator Promised Hope for a Dying Ohio Mill. Then Reality Set In.
item.description: The town’s unionized workers wanted to believe that there was something better than what private equity owners had offered.
item.dc:creator: Billy Witz and Maddie McGarvey

item.title: A Skeptical Supreme Court Puts Trump’s Tariffs and Economic Agenda in Question
item.description: President Trump has used his sweeping global tariffs as an economic tool and a political cudgel. A decision invalidating them could hamper his power.
item.dc:creator: Tony Romm, Ana Swanson and Alan Rappeport
